content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 t minus 8"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals negative 2 t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></math>. The point <math alttext="open parentheses k comma k close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> is a real number, lies on the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. What is the value of <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
